text: Six red squirrels were submitted for post - mortem examination with gross skin lesions consistent with SQPV infection , and seven red squirrels were acquired with abnormalities in the gastrointestinal tract that were compatible with a SADV infection . Of the three squirrels whose mortality was not thought related to SQPV or SADV infection , two had severe pediculosis and the other a severe pneumonia . As with the grey squirrels , swab samples effectively recovered both target and reference DNA in red squirrels , with only one arm swab failing to isolate squirrel DNA ( n = 6 for each cutaneous swab site and n = 7 for rectal swabs ) ( see absolute quantification results in the Online Resource S10 , Fig . S10 . 2 ) .
